name: afvvfunressn
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2), wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wi(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2), wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wi(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

stmt.origin: syl(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)), wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe))

body.origin:
|- wi(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))
-| wi(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe))
-| wi(wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2), wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wi(wn(wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1)))), wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe))
-| wi(wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

|- wi(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2), wfun(cres(c0, csn(c1))))
-| wi(wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(cafv(c0, c1), universe), wn(wcel(cafv(c0, c1), c2)))

comment: If the function value of a class for an argument is a set, the class restricted to the singleton of the argument is a function. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-May-2017.)
